N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 353.5 - Review of medical records

State Regulations

Applicants for disability benefits filed pursuant to sections
507-a and 605 are required to identify all hospitalizations and all doctors who
have treated the applicant in connection with his or her alleged disability. The determining authority may request that the applicant file a written waiver
of confidentiality with respect to medical records relating to such doctors and
hospitalizations. Upon receipt of such waiver, the Retirement System shall
attempt to obtain all medical records available from each doctor and hospital
identified by the applicant, and the determining authority shall review and
consider all records so obtained in connection with determining each
application. Notes
